title: feat(rand06-compat): rand compat wrapper
body: This PR adds a `rand` compat crate to support our upgrade to `rand` version `0.9`.

title: refactor(web-spawn): use snippets
body: This PR refactors `web-spawn` to use js snippets instead of the stack trace + blob hack.

title: feat: futures-limit and futures-plex
body:
This PR adds two new crates:

- `futures-plex` is a port of Tokio's memory simplex and duplex utilities but for `futures` traits instead. This saves us from having to pull in heavy tokio dependencies for testing or from using compat wrappers.
- `futures-limit` provides network simulation utilities. Namely, a rate limiter for `AsyncWrite` and a delay wrapper for `AsyncRead` which together can be used to simulate varying network conditions.

title: feat(web-spawn): first version
body: This PR adds the `web-spawn` crate, a replacement for both `wasm-bindgen-rayon` and `wasm_thread` while being more suitable to our needs.

title: chore: fix clippy warning from rust 1.83.0.
perf(utils): further optimise subset check.
body: As https://github.com/tlsnotary/tlsn/pull/664 starts using `is_subset` checks, I implemented a small optimisation — immediately return false if the subset candidate's left and right boundaries are not within/same as the other rangeset.

title: fix(serio): remove Unpin bound from item
body: This PR removes an unnecessary `Unpin` bound.

title: Feat/ws relay
body: THis PR merges the ws-relay branch into dev

title: feat(utils): Inplace operations and std traits
body: This PR adds inplace implementations for a couple of the set operations, and implements `std` traits for them.

title: feat(utils): extract_if backport
body:
This PR replaces our existing `FilterDrain`, backporting the std implementation of `extract_if` until it reaches stabilization.

Source code is directly copied (minus renaming) including the tests.

title: feat(utils): additional set operations
body:
Closes #8 

This PR adds the set intersection operation and additional subset implementations. I've also removed the superset operation which is redundant with subset.

Exhaustively testing these operations is difficult so I've added more fuzz targets, and included a proof for set-set intersection.

title: fix: prevent sending after ws client closed
body: This PR prevents an error caused by sending after websocket client closed.

title: Added unbounded memory channels
body: This PR adds unbounded memory channels in the helpers, wrapping `mpsc::UnboundedSender` and `mpsc::UnboundedReceiver`.

title: refactor(serio): encapsulate compat feature
body: This PR encapsulates the `compat` feature in `serio`, providing a single type for both sinks and streams.

title: feat(uid-mux): pre-allocate streams
body: This PR adds a feature to yamux wrapper for pre-allocating streams to reduce latency.

title: feat(uid-mux): TestFramedMux
body: This PR adds a framed mux utility which uses memory channels instead of serializing.

title: docs: add style guide
body: This PR copies the style guide from https://github.com/tlsnotary/tlsn/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md

title: feat(uid-mux): framed mux
body:
This PR adds support for muxers which return framed streams.

# Changes
- Add `Codec` trait to `serio`.
- Add `FramedUidMux` trait to `uid-mux` and provide a simple mux wrapper which implements it.

title: feat: uid-mux
body:
This PR moves/reimplements `uid-mux` in this repo.

# Changes
- Uses newer version of `yamux` which has better flow control. This should give us higher throughput.
- Stream ids are now hashed to a fixed-length
- Better logging
- Cleaner.

title: Make sure doctests are run in ci
feat(utils-aio): blocking macro
body: This PR adds a macro for conveniently using our async compute backend abstraction.

title: feat: serio
body:
This PR adds `serio` a new crate which provides IO abstractions built on `serde`. Rather than using `Sink<T>` or `Stream<Item = T>` from `futures` which are statically bounded to a specific type, this crate provides `Sink` and `Stream` which can be used to send and receive **any** serializable type. 

See the provided example for how ergonomic the API is. No more wrapper enums, boxing large variants, matching for the expected type, etc. In addition, an IO channel can be re-used for different protocols.

There are 2 main trade-offs I see with this approach compared to having wrapper enums with the `futures` traits:

1. These traits are not object-safe, so they can not be boxed.
2. When receiving an unexpected type, deserialization will fail without providing any indication as to what type was actually sent. This makes debugging harder. On top of that, if the "unexpected" type has an identical data structure deserialization will succeed which may lead to a confusing error downstream. This should not be considered a security issue, as it is always the responsibility of the developer to enforce invariants after deserialization if needed.

title: feat(spansy): conversion and partial eq traits
body: This PR adjusts and adds some conversion and partial eq traits for Span and spanned types.

title: feat(spansy): HTTP body content + parsing
body: This PR adds a `BodyContent` type in the http module, and now attempts to parse the body content if it is recognized. This does not yet support the chunked transfer encoding, that'll come later.

title: feat(spansy): add AsRef<Span<[u8]>> impl for Span<str>
body: This PR impls AsRef<Span<[u8]>> for Span<str>. This adds some flexibility when working with types containing both kinds of spans.

title: refactor: replace Identity trait with Step
body:
This PR replaces the `Identity` trait with `Step` which is similar to the trait in `std` but works on stable.

Closes #18

title: feat: add ToRangeSet trait
body: This PR adds a trait for getting a `RangeSet` from a reference to the implementing type.

title: refactor: remove type bound from struct def
body: This PR removes the `Copy + Ord` bound from the `RangeSet` struct def. It shouldn't be necessary.

title: feat: add fallible conversion to Range and len_ranges method
body: This PR adds fallible conversion to a single Range, and a method for getting the number of ranges in the set.

title: bug: fix incorrect RangeSet::max
body: This PR fixes a bug in the `RangeSet::max` function, which is supposed to return the maximum value *contained in the set*. Right now it returns what should be named `end`.

title: feat: RangeSet::shift_(left/right)
body: This PR implements shift methods for `RangeSet`

title: feat: RangeSet::split_off
body: This PR adds a `split_off` method to `RangeSet`

title: feat: IndexRanges
body: This PR adds `IndexRanges` which implements indexing of slices and string slices using `RangeSet`.

title: Add into inner method to enable closing TLS properly
body: Helps to solve https://github.com/tlsnotary/tlsn/issues/288

title: feat: impl ExactSizeIterator and DoubleEndedIterator
body: This PR implements `ExactSizeIterator` and `DoubleEndedIterator` for `RangeIter` simply by deferring to the inner iter impls.

title: feat: range utils
body:
This PR implements utilities for `Range`.

This functionality is a surface area potentially affecting security of the selective disclosure/verification protocols, so I've invested a bit more into ensuring correctness. I've implementing fuzzing for the more complex functionalities, as well as went as far to prove correctness for smaller sized sets (which should generalize to larger ones).

title: Deprecate bits module
body: This PR removes the bits module, as it is deprecated by `itybity`.

title: Refactor IO traits
body:
This PR improves our abstractions for IO channels.

# Changes
1. Introduce `IoStream` and `IoSink` traits which are simply super traits of their `futures::Stream` and `futures::Sink` counterparts with the error type set to `std::io::Error`. This is a matter of convenience for simplifying trait bounds.
2. Added `ExpectStreamExt` extension trait to obsolete the `expect_msg_or_err` macro with the `expect_next` method.
3. Rename `Channel` trait to `Duplex` and modify it to use the `IoStream` and `IoSink` traits. I think `Duplex` is a preferable name so that it is differentiated more from memory channels.
4. Rename `Duplex` to `MemoryDuplex`
